standards: 6.1.1 Reading and writing numbers up to 10,000,000 in numerals and words
objectives: Students can read and write numbers up to 10,000,000 in numeral and word forms correctly.
activities: Singing number songs up to 10,000,000
Writing numbers from words to numerals (e.g., 'seven million three hundred thousand' → 7,300,000)
'Find the Number' game – finding numbers on a large chart
assessment: Worksheets for writing numbers from words
aids: Number word cards (million, thousand, hundred, ten, one)

standards: 6.1.2 Comparing and arranging numbers up to 10,000,000
objectives: Students can compare two numbers up to 10,000,000 and arrange them in ascending or descending order.
activities: Arranging number cards in order
'Largest Number' game – comparing numbers in groups
Using base-ten blocks to show place value
assessment: Worksheets for arranging numbers in ascending/descending order
aids: Base-ten blocks (million, hundred thousand, ten thousand, thousand, hundred, ten, one)

standards: 6.2.1 Solving combined operations without brackets following the order of operations (BODMAS)
objectives: Students can solve mixed mathematical sentences (addition, subtraction, multiplication, division) without brackets following the order of operations (BODMAS).
activities: Using the BODMAS chart to show the order
Solving questions step-by-step
'Who is Faster?' game – solving mathematical sentences within a limited time
assessment: Worksheets for combined operations without brackets
Observation of the use of order of operations
kategori: Combined Operations following Order of Operations (BODMAS) & Complex Problems

standards: 6.2.2 Solving complex problems involving combined operations with brackets
objectives: Students can solve complex daily problems using combined operations with brackets following the order of operations (BODMAS).
activities: Using complex problem story cards
'Open Brackets First' activity – solving inside brackets first
Solving daily problems: '(4 + 3) × 5 – 10 = ?'
kategori: Combined Operations following Order of Operations (BODMAS) & Complex Problems

standards: 6.3.1 Adding and subtracting proper fractions and mixed numbers with different denominators
objectives: Students can add and subtract proper fractions and mixed numbers with different denominators using the common denominator method.
activities: Using fraction cards to show common denominators
Drawing circles and coloring parts for addition/subtraction
Solving daily problems: 'I ate ½ pizza, my sibling ate ⅓, what is the total?'
assessment: Worksheets for fraction addition/subtraction with different denominators
kategori: Mixed Fraction Operations (Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, Division)

standards: 6.3.2 Multiplying and dividing proper fractions and mixed numbers
objectives: Students can solve multiplication and division of proper fractions and mixed numbers using models or algorithms.
activities: Using fraction cards to show multiplication/division
Dividing one part into several equal parts
Solving daily problems: '⅔ × 3 = ?', '⅘ ÷ 2 = ?'
kategori: Mixed Fraction Operations (Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, Division)

standards: 6.4.1 Adding and subtracting decimals up to three decimal places
objectives: Students can add and subtract decimals up to three decimal places (e.g., 3.456 + 2.789, 5.678 – 2.345) using algorithms or grids.
activities: Using decimal grids for addition/subtraction
Writing mathematical sentences on the board
'Decimal Addition and Subtraction' game in pairs
kategori: Mixed Decimal Operations (Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, Division)

standards: 6.4.2 Multiplying and dividing decimals up to three decimal places
objectives: Students can solve multiplication and division of decimals up to three decimal places using algorithms or base-ten blocks.
activities: Using base-ten blocks to show the multiplication/division process
'Share Equally' activity – dividing decimals into several parts
Solving daily problems: '3.6 ÷ 4 = ?', '2.5 × 3 = ?'
kategori: Mixed Decimal Operations (Addition, Subtraction, Multiplication, Division)

standards: 6.5.1 Converting between fractions, percentages, and decimals
objectives: Students can convert between fractions, percentages, and decimals (e.g., ½ = 50% = 0.5) using conversion methods.
activities: Using conversion charts to show relationships
'Quick Match' game – matching fractions, percentages, and decimals
Solving daily problems: '25% discount = ? in fractions'
unit: Unit 5: Percentages (Daily Problems Including Service Tax & Rebates)

standards: 6.5.2 Solving daily problems including service tax and rebates
objectives: Students can solve daily situations such as service tax (6%) and rebates (10%) using percentages.
activities: Drama: 'Original price RM100, 6% tax, what is the final price?'
Using tax/rebate problem story cards
'Tax Shop' game in groups
unit: Unit 5: Percentages (Daily Problems Including Service Tax & Rebates)

standards: 6.6.1 Understanding concepts of savings, investment, and simple interest
objectives: Students can understand the meaning of savings, investment, and simple interest (e.g., RM1000 saved, 3% interest per year).
activities: Mini bank game: saving money, calculating interest
Using story cards to describe savings/investment situations
Building a yearly savings table
kategori: Concepts of Savings, Investment & Simple Interest

standards: 6.6.2 Solving daily problems involving savings, investment, and simple interest
objectives: Students can solve daily situations such as calculating savings interest or investment profit using the simple interest formula.
activities: Drama: 'Save RM2000, 4% interest per year, how much interest after 2 years?'
Using interest problem story cards
'Mini Investment' game in pairs
aids: Real objects (bank model, toy savings book)
kategori: Concepts of Savings, Investment & Simple Interest

standards: 6.7.1 Calculating rate (speed) using the formula (distance ÷ time)
objectives: Students can calculate rate (speed) using the formula (distance ÷ time) in km/h or m/s.
activities: Using formula charts to show relationships
Solving daily problems: 'A car travels 120 km in 2 hours, speed = ?'
'Calculate Speed' game – calculating speed within a limited time

standards: 6.7.2 Calculating distance or time using the formula (distance = rate × time, time = distance ÷ rate)
objectives: Students can calculate distance or time using formulas based on the given rate.
activities: Using formula charts to show relationships
Solving daily problems: 'Speed 60 km/h, time 3 hours, distance = ?'
'Calculate Distance/Time' game – calculating within a limited time

standards: 6.8.1 Solving daily problems involving length, mass, and volume of liquid
objectives: Students can solve daily situations such as calculating fence length, item weight, or water volume using standard units.
activities: Drama: 'Garden fence is 50m, how long is the fence for 3 gardens?'
Using measurement problem story cards
'Calculate Measurement' game in pairs
unit: Unit 8: Measurement (Length, Mass, Volume of Liquid - Daily Problems)

standards: 6.8.2 Converting measurement units (km to m, liter to ml) and solving daily problems
objectives: Students can convert measurement units (e.g., 2.5 km = 2500 m) and solve daily problems involving unit conversion.
activities: Using unit conversion charts to show relationships
Solving daily problems: 'Road length is 3.5 km, how many meters?'
'Quick Conversion' game – converting units within a limited time
unit: Unit 8: Measurement (Length, Mass, Volume of Liquid - Daily Problems)

standards: 6.9.1 Calculating volume of cuboid using the formula (length × width × height)
objectives: Students can calculate the volume of a cuboid using a formula or base-ten block method.
activities: Using base-ten blocks to build a cuboid and calculate volume
Measuring cuboid dimensions and calculating volume
Solving daily problems: 'Box 10cm x 5cm x 3cm, what is its volume?'
kategori: Calculating Volume of Cuboid & Daily Problems

standards: 6.9.2 Solving daily problems involving volume of cuboid
objectives: Students can solve daily situations such as filling water in a bathtub or box using cuboid volume.
activities: Drama: 'Bathtub 2m x 1m x 0.5m, how many liters of water?'
Using volume problem story cards
'Calculate Volume' game in pairs
kategori: Calculating Volume of Cuboid & Daily Problems

standards: 6.10.1 Calculating the mean (average) for a set of data
objectives: Students can calculate the mean (average) for a set of data (e.g., test scores) using the formula (total ÷ quantity).
activities: Collecting students' test score data, calculating the average
Calculating friends' average body weight
'Calculate Average' game – calculating average within a limited time

standards: 6.10.2 Calculating the range for a set of data
objectives: Students can calculate the range (difference between the largest and smallest values) for a set of data.
activities: Using test score data to calculate the range
Finding the range of friends' body weights
'Find the Range' game – finding the difference between largest/smallest values

standards: 6.11.1 Understanding the concept of rate as a ratio between two quantities with different units (including time)
objectives: Students can understand rate as a ratio between two quantities with different units (e.g., 60 km/h, 5 pieces/RM1, 100 m/min).
activities: Using story cards to show rate (speed, unit price, velocity)
Solving daily problems: 'Car speed 80 km/h, 2 hours = ? km'
'Quick Rate' game – calculating rate within a limited time
unit: Unit 11: Ratio and Rate (Rate Involving Time)

standards: 6.11.2 Solving daily problems involving rate involving time
objectives: Students can solve daily situations such as speed, time, or distance using rates that involve time.
activities: Drama: 'Bus travels 90 km/h, 3 hours = ? km'
Using rate-time problem story cards
'Calculate Distance' game – calculating distance based on rate and time
unit: Unit 11: Ratio and Rate (Rate Involving Time)

standards: 6.12.1 Solving simple problems involving proportion (e.g., if 2 pieces are RM1, 6 pieces = ?)
objectives: Students can solve daily problems involving proportion using multiplication or division methods.
activities: Using story cards to show proportion
Solving daily problems: '3 apples RM6, 5 apples = ?'
'Calculate Price' game – calculating price based on rate

standards: 6.12.2 Using cross-multiplication method to solve proportion problems
objectives: Students can use the cross-multiplication method to solve proportion problems (e.g., 2/3 = x/6, find x).
activities: Using cross-multiplication method charts
Solving questions step-by-step
'Quick Cross-Multiply' game – solving within a limited time

standards: 6.13.1 Adding and subtracting positive and negative decimals
objectives: Students can add and subtract positive and negative decimals using a number line or algorithms.
activities: Using a number line to show decimal addition/subtraction
Solving daily problems: 'Morning temperature -2.5°C, rises 4.5°C, what is it now?'
'Decimal Addition and Subtraction' game in pairs
unit: Unit 13: Positive and Negative Decimals (Basic Operations)
kategori: Basic Operations for Positive & Negative Decimals

standards: 6.13.2 Multiplying and dividing positive and negative decimals
objectives: Students can solve multiplication and division of positive and negative decimals using algorithms or base-ten blocks.
activities: Using base-ten blocks to show the multiplication/division process
'Share Equally' activity – dividing decimals into several parts
Solving daily problems: '-3.6 ÷ 2 = ?', '2.5 × (-3) = ?'
unit: Unit 13: Positive and Negative Decimals (Basic Operations)
kategori: Basic Operations for Positive & Negative Decimals

standards: 6.14.1 Identifying and measuring vertically opposite angles
objectives: Students can identify and measure vertically opposite angles (equal angles when two lines intersect) using a protractor.
activities: Using a protractor to measure vertically opposite angles
Finding vertically opposite angles in the environment
'Measure Opposite Angles' game – measuring angles on cards
assessment: Worksheets for measuring vertically opposite angles
unit: Unit 14: Lines and Angles (Vertically Opposite Angles, Adjacent Angles)

standards: 6.14.2 Identifying and measuring adjacent angles
objectives: Students can identify and measure adjacent angles (neighboring angles that form a straight line) using a protractor.
activities: Drawing adjacent angles and measuring them
Finding adjacent angles in textbooks and measuring them
'Guess the Adjacent Angle' game – teacher shows angle, student guesses name and measures
assessment: Worksheets for labeling and measuring adjacent angles
Oral Q&A: 'What angle is this and how many degrees?'
unit: Unit 14: Lines and Angles (Vertically Opposite Angles, Adjacent Angles)

standards: 6.15.1 Calculating the circumference of a circle using formula (π × diameter or 2π × radius)
objectives: Students can calculate circle circumference using formula (π × diameter or 2π × radius) with π ≈ 3.14.
activities: Using paper circles to measure diameter and calculate circumference
Solving daily problems: 'Wheel radius 25cm, circumference = ?'
'Calculate Circumference' game – calculating circumference within a limited time
unit: Unit 15: Circles (Circumference and Area of Circles)
kategori: Calculating Circumference and Area of Circles

standards: 6.15.2 Calculating the area of a circle using formula (π × radius²)
objectives: Students can calculate circle area using formula (π × radius²) with π ≈ 3.14.
activities: Using paper circles to measure radius and calculate area
Solving daily problems: 'Table base radius 30cm, area = ?'
'Calculate Area' game – calculating area within a limited time
unit: Unit 15: Circles (Circumference and Area of Circles)
kategori: Calculating Circumference and Area of Circles

standards: 6.16.1 Organizing data in tables and bar charts with scales
objectives: Students can organize collected data in tables and bar charts with appropriate scales.
activities: Collecting data on the number of books read by friends
Building tables and bar charts with a scale of 1 unit = 5 people
Labeling horizontal and vertical axes with scales
assessment: Student table and bar chart results
Observation of construction accuracy and scale
unit: Unit 16: Data Management (Data Interpretation, Data Organization)

standards: 6.16.2 Interpreting information from bar charts, pie charts, and tables
objectives: Students can read and interpret information from bar charts, pie charts, and tables to make conclusions.
activities: Interpreting self-built bar charts and pie charts
Q&A: 'Which is the most?', 'What percentage likes red?'
'Guess the Answer' game based on charts
aids: Ready-made bar chart and pie chart examples
unit: Unit 16: Data Management (Data Interpretation, Data Organization)

standards: 6.17.1 Understanding probability as a measure of the likelihood of an event occurring
objectives: Students can understand probability as a measure of the likelihood of an event occurring (e.g., impossible, not impossible, possible, very likely, certain).
activities: Using event cards to show probability levels
'Guess the Possibility' game – guessing the probability of daily events
Building a probability chart (impossible → certain)
assessment: Oral assessment: 'What is the chance of rain today?'

standards: 6.17.2 Calculating the probability of an event in fraction form
objectives: Students can calculate the probability of an event in fraction form (e.g., 1/6 for a die to roll a 4).
activities: Rolling a die 20 times, recording results
Calculating probability of specific numbers
'Probability Dice' game – guessing rolling probability

standards: 6.18.1 Forming algebraic expressions based on daily situations
objectives: Students can form algebraic expressions (e.g., 2x + 3) based on daily situations like item prices or quantity of objects.
activities: Using story cards to show algebraic situations
Solving daily problems: 'Price of one book is x, 2 books = 2x'
'Form Expressions' game – building expressions from situations

standards: 6.18.2 Simplifying algebraic expressions (e.g., 2x + 3x = 5x)
objectives: Students can simplify algebraic expressions by combining like terms.
activities: Using algebra blocks to show combined terms
Solving questions step-by-step
'Combine Terms' game – simplifying expressions within a limited time

standards: 6.19.1 Solving simple linear equations in one variable (e.g., x + 5 = 12)
objectives: Students can solve simple linear equations in one variable using inverse operation methods.
activities: Using equation cards to show inverse methods
Solving questions step-by-step
'Find Value of x' game – solving within a limited time
kategori: Solving Linear Equations in One Variable

standards: 6.19.2 Solving daily problems involving linear equations
objectives: Students can solve daily situations such as item prices or quantity of objects using linear equations.
activities: Drama: 'Price of one book is x, 3 books + RM5 = RM20, find x'
Using linear equation problem story cards
'Calculate Value of x' game in pairs
assessment: Worksheets for linear equation problem solving
kategori: Solving Linear Equations in One Variable
